intro: Angelica hakonensis var. nikoensis, commonly known as the Niko Angelica, is a rare and distinctive member of the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Japanese islands of Hokkaido and Honshu, where it thrives in moist, temperate climates. The plant features large, compound leaves with a pungent aroma, and its tall, branched stems bear small, greenish-yellow flowers. It is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Japanese herbal medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
